intro: Nauclea obtusa var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy nauclea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody shrub structure with simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by elliptical, woody pods containing flat, winged seeds. It is adapted to thrive in dry, open habitats and is often found in savannas and woodland areas. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and ecologists studying plant adaptations in arid environments.
